_header: Saint Anastasia was I-born at Rome by old dawe
Subjects: saints’ lives; Anastasia, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Anastasia in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Anastace was ibore at rome bi olde daweOf swiþe heie men
                    icome al of þe olde lawe…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…& þe maner is to muche anerþe to lye lesingeTo
                    þe Ioie of heuene þat heo is Inne godes ous bringe

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint anastas was I bore at rome by olde dawe& of swyþe
                    hyȝe men ycome al of þe olde lawe…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& þe maner is mochil in erþe for to lyȝe
                    lesingeIn to þe ioy þat ȝhe is inne god oure soulus
                    bringe
Bod779.Note: Complete text; second occurrence in MS.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Anastace was y bore At Rome be olde daweOf swiþe heye
                    men she come Al of þe olde lawe…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…And þe maner is to myche on eorþe forto leone
                    lesingTo þe heye ioye þat she is inne god vs alle
                    bringe
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Seint Anastace was ibore at rome by olde daweOf swuþe heie men
                    icome al of þe olde lawe…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…And þe manere is to muche an eorþe forto luue
                    lesyngeTo þe ioie of heuene þer he is Inne god oure soule
                    bringe
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.586-90.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Anastace was ybore at Rome by olde daweOf swiþe heye men
                    as of þe olde lawe…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…And þe manere is to muche in eorþe ffor to leone
                    lesyngeTo þe ioye þat ȝeo is ynne god oure soules
                    bringe

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint anastase was ibore at rome bi olde daweof suiþe heie men heo com al of þe olde lawe…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …nou god for loue of seint anastase our soule so wisseþat we mote ford wit hire come to heuen blisse
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xCi” added to left margin by later hand (f. 222v).
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Cotton_MS_Julius_D_IX.

BLHar2277.First Lines: SEinte Anastace was ibore at Rome bi olde daweOf swiþe heȝemen icome al of þe olde lawe…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …& þe maner is to moche an vrþe forto leoue lesingeTo þe ioye of heuene þat heo is inne for hire loue god ous bringe
